verses.verse: A plaintive song of David, which he sang to the LORD concerning Cush,[b] a Benjaminite.
O LORD, my God, I take refuge in you; keep me safe from all my pursuers and deliver me,
lest like a lion they tear me to pieces and carry me off, with no one to rescue me.
O LORD, my God, if I have done this, if my hands are stained with guilt,
if I have repaid a friend with treachery— I who spared the lives of those who without cause were my enemies—[c]
then let my foe pursue and overtake me; let him trample my life into the ground and leave my honor in the dust. Selah
Rise up, O LORD, in your indignation; rise against the fury of my enemies. Rouse yourself for me, and fulfill the judgment you have decreed.
Let the peoples assemble in your presence as you sit above them enthroned on high.
The LORD is the judge of the nations. Therefore, pass judgment on me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, according to my innocence, O Most High.
Put an end to the malice of the wicked but continue to sustain the righteous, O God of justice, you who search minds and hearts.[d]
God is a shield to me; he saves those who are upright of heart.
God is a just judge, a God who expresses his indignation every day.
When a sinner refuses to repent, God sharpens his sword, and he bends and aims his bow.
He has prepared deadly weapons for him and made his arrows into fiery shafts.
[e]Behold, he who conceives iniquity and is pregnant with mischief will give birth to lies.
He digs a pit and makes it deep, but he will fall into the trap he has made.
His wickedness will recoil upon his own head, and his violence will fall back on his own crown.
